We are not planning to address this in 2.1.

There are a few nasty issues here:
1. Overloading the tree viewer (i.e. number of entries in the view)
2. Flooding the UI queue with additions to the tree

No action planned yet.

Jared, this appears fixed (in HEAD) with the new background label support. 
Please use this as a test case for your work.

The test program behaves reasonably well with the new background label support 
(the UI remains responsive). But I ran into two exceptions while debugging the 
test case. Both of these exceptions stem from the fact that our access the the 
list of threads in JDIDebugTarget isn't thread-safe.

Fixed in JDIDebugTarget. We now iterate over a copy of the list everywhere.

Please verify, DarinS.

We believe that the NPE is still possible as listed in comment #7 as #clone is 
not thread safe from what we can see.

Added synchronization around code that adds/removes/iterates. Please verify, 
DarinS.
